pr_title: Update: Allow unlimited default player colors & add a default for 'color.Impassable'

timeline.message: Add a utility to construct colors 'ColorUtils'

Allow unlimited default player colors, default the impassable player color, and ensure stable colors

- Cache playerColors such that default player colors are stable. Requesting the color
  of a player will always return the same color.

- Generate default player colors if we exhaust the default player color list. Once
  we exceed the colors on the list, start to generate colors randomly.

- Generate default (random) player colors in a stable manner, always generate
  the same random default player color per player name (use a fixed random seed
  based on player name).
Preserve stack trace message in ColorUtils error handling

timeline.bodyText: The name might be a bit misleading, it's more like an arbitrary number, also it doesn't look like this method is used at all.
timeline.author: RoiEXLab

replies.bodyText: It was used, then I thought it made sense to keep the colors "sticky" so that games would be consistent. At a library/API level, I wouldn't want someone to use the randomColor(long randomSeed) API unless that is really what they wanted. I'm concerned someone would see that and either send a random seed because they had to or not use this API. My hope is that if you have a no-arg API, that would fit what you need. I don't think this is enough code to quite fit YAGNI given the library context, so I'm leaning we clean it up later if it's not used after a few months.
replies.author: DanVanAtta

replies.bodyText: In what sense is the name misleading, I'm not quite sure I see that. Could you help me understand that perspective?
replies.author: DanVanAtta

replies.bodyText:
If I read "random" I expect a random result i.e. the result differs every time.
I think you can't tell that this method always returns the same arbitrary color from the name and javadoc.
replies.author: RoiEXLab

replies.bodyText:
Ah, but be careful, the sequence of results will be the same if you restart the game, but that sequence will be random. If for example you request random colors in a different order for player names, the result would depend on the ordering of player names.
The other API is deterministic by player name because we use the player name hashcode for the random seed which will give us a fixed sequence for that player name (and we only grab the first element from that sequence).
Is it still your opinion that the method name should change or be clarified?
replies.author: DanVanAtta

replies.bodyText: I could be missing something, but right now this method has "123" hardcoded as the seed, so if it were ever to be called the color would always be the exact same
replies.author: RoiEXLab

replies.bodyText:
Ah yeah, it would be exactly the same every time, that's a bug : )
I was thinking that the random generator would be new'ed up once rather than each time.
replies.author: DanVanAtta
